data.title: Le Nuku Hiva by Pearl Resorts
data.text:
CURRENCY

The Pacific Franc (XPF) is indexed on the Euro.

€1 = XPF 119,33 or XPF 1 000 = €8.38

Most credit cards are accepted. There are two ATMs in Taiohae, Nuku Hiva's capital. Tipping is not customary in Polynesia, and remains at the customer's discretion. Prices are fixed and bargaining is not habitual, except for handicrafts.

SEASONS

Tahiti and Her Islands enjoy a subtropical climate with an average temperature of 27°C (81°F) all year round. However, there is a warm season from January to April, a rainy season from May to August, and a cooler, drier season from September to December. Ocean temperature is about 25°C (77°F).

LANGUAGES

French is the official language. However, most people speak Marquesan among themselves.

CELL PHONES

GSM is the standard. There are two local cell phone operators in French Polynesia : Vini and Vodafone. For the Marquesas, choose Vini. Cell phones and prepaid cards are available for sale.

TIME ZONE

UTC/GMT -9 ½ hours

POWER

220 Volts 50 Hz

HEALTH

French Polynesia is known for the quality of its healthcare. The Taaone Hospital on the main island of Tahiti is fitted with state-of-the art equipment. Tahiti also has two private clinics, many medical doctors' offices and dispensaries in Tahiti.

Nuku Hiva is home to the only hospital in the Marquesas archipelago. It is in constant contact with Tahiti to implement medical evacuations when needed.

There are no dangerous animals or venomous insects in French Polynesia.

WHAT TO PACK

Sunscreen, insect repellent, sunglasses, hat or cap, sandals, your medical treatment, light and ventilated shoes and clothing for better comfort on land and in the water.

We recommend that you purchase mosquito repellent on arrival, it is more efficient than repellent sold in Europe and elsewhere !
